to rush (to), to dash, to race
to retreat, to flee, to defect (to)
to run away, to abscond, to elope
to flash (of lightning), to streak, to shoot (through; e.g. of pain), to run (through), to flare, to flit (e.g. across one's face), to spread quickly (of news, shock, etc.)
to go (e.g. bad, to extremes), to become, to turn, to take to (e.g. crime), to get carried away by (e.g. one's emotions), to get involved in, to get wrapped up in

running about, making every effort (to do), busying oneself (with), being busily engaged (in), good offices, efforts
busying oneself about (something), being on the move, bestirring oneself, on the go, taking an active interest

sdata.j: たまに↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓の↑自由↑↓じゆう↓↑奔放↑↓ほんぽう↓な↑態度↑↓たいど↓は↑無礼↑↓ぶれい↓に↑見↑↓み↓えることがある。
sdata.e: Sometimes her free manner seems rude.

sdata.j: ↑今日↑↓きょう↓は↑借金↑↓しゃっきん↓の↑工面↑↓くめん↓で↑東奔西走↑↓とうほんせいそう↓した。
sdata.e: I was on the go all day today looking for a loan.

sdata.j: ↑日本人↑↓にっぽんじん↓からが、アメリカ↑人↑↓じん↓は↑不安定↑↓ふあんてい↓で、↑自由↑↓じゆう↓↑奔放↑↓ほんぽう↓に↑見↑↓み↓える。
sdata.e: Americans appear unsettled and uncontrolled to Japanese.

sdata.j: さすが、お↑嬢様↑↓じょうさま↓。↑自由↑↓じゆう↓↑奔放↑↓ほんぽう↓な↑生活↑↓せいかつ↓をしていたわけじゃないんだ。
sdata.e: Just what you'd expect of a young lady, you certainly weren't left to live as you pleased.

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓は↑奔放↑↓ほんぽう↓な↑生↑↓い↓き↑方↑↓かた↓にあこがれている。
sdata.e: I long for an uninhibited way of life.

sdata.j: ↑束縛↑↓そくばく↓されず、↑自由↑↓じゆう↓↑奔放↑↓ほんぽう↓に↑生↑↓い↓きるのが↑好↑↓す↓き。
sdata.e: I like to live a free life, unrestrained by things around me.

sdata.j: トムって、↑本当↑↓ほんとう↓に↑自由↑↓じゆう↓↑奔放↑↓ほんぽう↓ね。
sdata.e: Tom is truly free from inhibition.

sdata.j: トムって、↑本当↑↓ほんとう↓に↑自由↑↓じゆう↓↑奔放↑↓ほんぽう↓ね。
sdata.e: Tom is truly a free spirit.

sdata.j: ↑鳴↑↓な↓り↑物入↑↓ものい↓りで↑加入↑↓かにゅう↓したスター↑選手↑↓せんしゅ↓が↑自由↑↓じゆう↓↑奔放↑↓ほんぽう↓すぎて、↑監督↑↓かんとく↓から↑苦言↑↓くげん↓を↑呈↑↓てい↓された。
sdata.e: The new star player, who joined with much fanfare, was behaving with such abandon that he was admonished by the coach.

words.gloss: running about, making every effort (to do), busying oneself (with), being busily engaged (in), good offices, efforts
